label: A3B7C2_oC48_66_el_f2gl_l-001
title: Orthorhombic Ba$_{3}$Zr$_{2}$S$_{7}$ Structure
comments:
The individual layers of this structure resemble \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C_cP5_221_a_c_b-001}{cubic perovskite ($E2_{1}$)}, and orthorhombic Ba$_{3}$Zr$_{2}$S$_{7}$ is a Ruddlesden-Popper structure. 
 At low temperatures this transforms to a \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B7C2_tP48_136_fj_2eghj_j-001}{tetragonal structure}. 
 AFLOW shifts rotates the reported structure by 90$^\circ$ about the z-axis, so that the long axis in now in the x-direction, and then shifts the origin by (a/2,0,0).
